FuncDef:
The dhcp receive server-packet command enables the device to process ACK packets that are destined for gateways and proactively sent by a DHCP server when users are online.
The undo dhcp receive server-packet command disables the device from processing ACK packets that are destined for gateways and proactively sent by a DHCP server when users are online.
By default, the device does not process ACK packets that are destined for gateways and proactively sent by a DHCP server when users are online.

ParaDef.Info:
ACK packets from a DHCP server.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When the NE40E changes bandwidth for online users, the DHCP server sends to the NE40E ACK packets carrying new QoS profile names. However, in most cases, the NE40E directly drops these ACK packets destined for gateways. The dhcp receive server-packet command enables the NE40E to process ACK packets proactively sent by a DHCP server when users are online.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
The dhcp receive server-packet command takes effect for users who go online after you have configured this command.
